Are electric toothbrushes suitable for children with sensitive gums? Ideal for kids with sensitive teeth, this children's electric toothbrush features a sensitive mode and a soft brush head, making it perfect for ages 3 to 6 and for those just starting out! Which is kids electric toothbrush replacement heads? Dentists recommend changing the brush head every 3 months.Seago childrens electric toothbrush comes 8 replacement brush heads will last 2 year use.You can buy more brush heads at the Seago store. Asin：B0CT5HSZQ6 Are there electric toothbrushes designed for specific age groups? The kids electric toothbrush has a total of 5 brushing modes, Sensitive Mode for toddlers and beginners between the ages of 3 and 6, and Clean Mode for children between the ages of 6 and 10. We recommend white mode for ages 10 and up. Do electric toothbrushes help teach proper brushing or safety shut-offs? This electric toothbrush for kids features a 2-minute automatic shut-off and a memory function, along with a 30-second zone change reminder. These elements help children establish healthy brushing habits. Do electric toothbrushes help motivate kids to brush longer? The stickers that come with the children's electric toothbrush are designed to make tooth brushing more enjoyable and interactive, featuring playful designs that help capture kids' attention during their dental care routine. 2 Types of Brush Heads Color Fade Bristle Color fade bristle brush head can better remind to replace the brush head every three months. Copper Free Bristle Copper free bristle planting brush head can prevent the accumulation of dirt. Extra Soft Bristle Extra soft bristle brush head reduces the discomfort of brushing for sensitive gums people. 8 Brush Heads 8 brush heads = 2 years Extra soft bristles+ Sensitive mode：Suggest for toddiler 3-6 years Color-fade bristiles + Any mode：suggest for toddler 6+ years How to use the sticker? Step 1 Cut out the letter that you wanted from the complete sticker. Step 2 Separate the transparent sticker from the white color paper. The letter should stay with the transparent film. Step 3 Put the transparent film in place and press the sticker. Step 4 Take off the plastic film and the colorful alphabet letters should stay on the surface of the toothbrush.
